poem:
### Morning Headlines

The sky, a fragile scroll,
unfurls today's aching news:
names slide into silence.
Across the seas,
a history etched in sand,
or in shadows of old walls,
defies erasure.
Ghosts walk,
while pens scratch futures
promised, then taken back.
Sanctions blur,
like words whispered
too late to mend,
too loud to dismiss.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
